intro: Calycera calcitrapa, commonly known as the stonecress, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant has small, clustered white or yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and covered in a fine layer of white wax. Calycera calcitrapa is often found growing on rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in dry, sunny environments.
